page.title: 08LANDSCAPES
page.content:
THE LANDSCAPE OF DRUMCHAPEL IS QUITE HILLY BUT INTO KNIGHTSWOOD IT IS QUITE FLAT.THERE ARE A LOT OF DRUMLINS CREATED BY GLACIATION IN DRUMCHAPEL. DRUMCHAPEL TAKES ITS NAME FROM THE MANY DRUMLINS IN DRUMCHAPEL. MOST OF THE LAND IN DRUMCHAPEL HAS BEEN USED FOR A LARGE HOUSING SCHEME BUT THERE IS STILL A BIT OF WOODLAND LEFT HERE. THERE ARE A FEW FARMS AND SOME PARKS IN THE AREA WE ARE SURVEYING SUCH AS DAWSHOLM AND COLQUHOUN PARK...ETC THE KNIGHTSWOOD AREA IS FLAT AND IT IS EASY TO BUILD ON.
BEARSDEN IS QUITE HILLY,SHARING THE SAME LOWLAND GLACIATED LANDSCAPE AS DRUMCHAPEL.
